meanings.sent1: The companies decided to cartelize to control the market.
meanings.sent2: It is illegal for businesses to cartelize and fix prices.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends jokingly planned to cartelize their lemonade stands.
meanings.sent4: In the game, players can cartelize their resources to gain an advantage.
meanings.sent5: The idea to cartelize the neighborhood bake sales spread quickly.

meanings.sent1: The drug lords agreed to cartelize their operations for more power.
meanings.sent2: Countries may cartelize to control the production of a certain resource.
meanings.sent3: The kids in the class pretended to cartelize their toys for a fun game.
meanings.sent4: The rival gangs decided to cartelize their territories for peace.
meanings.sent5: The plan to cartelize the music industry faced opposition from independent artists.

meanings.sent1: The oil-producing countries often cartelize to influence oil prices.
meanings.sent2: Some companies may cartelize to avoid competition and maximize profits.
meanings.sent3: The students tried to cartelize their study group for better grades.
meanings.sent4: The political parties seemed to cartelize their policies for the upcoming election.
meanings.sent5: The decision to cartelize the trade routes was met with mixed reactions.
